intro: Erigeron eatonii, commonly known as Eaton's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly found in the western regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It features daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers, blooming in late summer to early fall. Its foliage is usually gray-green, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments.
